The '''Signed and Encrypted Email Over the Internet''' ('''SEEOTI''') initiative is an approach to providing [[small and medium enterprises]] with the ability to communicate securely with one another, government defence ministries and major aerospace and defence contractors, allowing them to play a full part in the defence supply chain.<ref>{{cite web |first=Carl | last = Billson | title=Signed, sealed and delivered: making email secure | url=http://www.ukceb.org/RWFilePub.php?cat=429&dx=1&ob=3&rpn=catviewleafpublic429&id=105189}}</ref>
== Overview ==
SEEOTI implements the secure email specifications defined by the Transglobal Secure Collaboration Program ([[Transglobal Secure Collaboration Project|TSCP]]). These support interoperable signing and encryption of email messages in a federated environment.<ref>{{cite web | title=TSCP description | url=http://www.asd-ssg.org/tscp}}</ref> In addition, the security labelling of email messages is supported with a network border [[Guard (information security)|guard]] being able to check labels even though messages are encrypted. This meets the goal of protecting [[Intellectual Property]] in the global business environment,<ref>{{cite web | title=Email in security hot seat with rise of cloud, BYOD | url=http://www.csoonline.com/article/711847/email-in-security-hot-seat-with-rise-of-cloud-byod }}</ref> which is of particular importance to the UK Cyber Security Strategy as intellectual property is seen as key to the growth of the economy.<ref>{{cite web | first=Jacqui | last=Griffiths | title=Doing More for Less | url=http://digital.onwindows.com/touch/2012/spring/index.html#/35/zoomed}}</ref>
[[Deep-Secure]] organised a trial of SEEOTI for [[UK MoD|UK MOD]] and the [[UK Cyber Security Community#UKCeB|UK Council for Electronic Business]]. This integrated Commercial Off The Shelf ([[Commercial off-the-shelf|COTS]]) products from TITUS, [[Boldon James]] and Deep-Secure to provide the system's email security functionality. Deep-Secure were selected as the overall winner of the UKCeB Excellence Awards 2011 for their work on SEEOTI in February 2012.<ref>{{cite web | title=The 3rd UKCeB Good Practice Marketplace & Excellence Awards & Special HFI Award - 2012 |url=http://www.adsgroup.org.uk/articles/28483}}</ref> Deep-Secure and its partners Adept4, Intercede and Trustis are providing a SEEOTI solution as a service.<ref>{{cite web | title=Intercede, Deep-Secure and adept4 partner to launch secure email service | url=http://www.prweb.com/releases/2012/4/prweb9432822.htm}}</ref> [[Nexor]] provide compatible products.

page.title: Socialist Party of Great Britain debates

revision.text:
{{use dmy dates|date=January 2017}} Debates between the [[Socialist Party of Great Britain]] and other groups were of particular importance in bringing the party case to an outside audience without the sometimes off-putting rhetoric of platform speaking, or the one-sidedness of educational talks. A prime instance of this importance for the party is the case of Richard Headicar, a former [[Campaign for Nuclear Disarmament]] speaker, won over after debating with the party. Of rather wider historical importance were the debates with the [[Revolutionary Communist Party (UK, 1944)|Revolutionary Communist Party]] in the late 1940s. In the course of these Sammy Cash persuaded the RCP’s [[Jock Haston]] of the [[state capitalist]] nature of the [[Soviet Union]]. The idea was then relayed to [[Tony Cliff]], from which it formed the genesis of the [[Socialist Workers Party (UK)|Socialist Workers Party]].
Debates were not a major part of [[Socialist Party of Great Britain]] propaganda until the 1930s, reliance being instead put on outdoor speaking, particularly at established street corner venues (as can be seen, debates at outdoor venues were not however unknown). The Indian Summer of SPGB debating was clearly in the 1980s, with a range and number never previously seen. In the last ten years debating has virtually ceased to be an element of SPGB propaganda.
It was in fact the only Marxist group in Britain (in Germany, the Communist Party of Germany engaged in such debates) that would share a platform to debate against those from the [[far right]] such as Probyn, Goulding and Raven Thompson from the [[British Union of Fascists]] and [[Denis Pirie]] from the [[National Front (UK)|National Front]].
It may be noted that until the 1970s at least, debates, like lectures and talks, were primarily held in the winter months. Although obviously skewed towards [[London]], it is obvious just how concentrated in the capital SPGB activity has been.

[[File:Stafford Hospital Overview.jpg|thumb|Stafford Hospital now renamed County Hospital]] The '''Stafford Hospital scandal''' concerns poor care and high mortality rates amongst patients at the [[County Hospital, Stafford|Stafford Hospital]], [[Stafford]], England, in the late 2000s. The hospital was run by the [[Mid Staffordshire NHS Foundation Trust]], and supervised by the [[West Midlands Strategic Health Authority]]. It has been renamed [[County Hospital, Stafford|County Hospital]]. == Background == Julie Bailey, whose mother died in her home, in 2007, started a campaign called Cure the NHS to demand changes in the hospital. She was supported by the [[Staffordshire Newsletter]], but the [[Public and Patient Involvement Forum]] and the Governors of the Trust were defensive.{{cite news|title=Staffordshire hospital scandal: the hidden story|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/health/healthnews/5030012/Staffordshire-hospital-scandal-the-hidden-story.html|accessdate=1 January 2014|newspaper=Daily Telegraph|date=22 March 2009|location=London|first=Patrick|last=Sawer}} The scandal came to national attention because of an investigation by the [[Healthcare Commission]] in 2008 into the operation of [[County Hospital, Stafford|Stafford Hospital]] in [[Stafford]], England. The commission was first alerted by the "apparently high mortality rates in patients admitted as emergencies".{{citation|url=http://www.cqc.org.uk/_db/_documents/Investigation_into_Mid_Staffordshire_NHS_Foundation_Trust.pdf|title=Investigation into Mid Staffordshire NHS Foundation Trust|publisher=Healthcare Commission |date=March 2009|isbn=978-1-84562-220-6|accessdate=6 May 2009}} When the [[Mid Staffordshire NHS Foundation Trust]], which is responsible for running the hospital, failed to provide what the commission considered an adequate explanation, a full-scale investigation was carried out between March and October 2008. Released in March 2009, the commission's report severely criticised the [[NHS Foundation Trust|Foundation Trust]]'s management and detailed the appalling conditions and inadequacies at the hospital. Many press reports suggested that because of the substandard care between 400 and 1200 more patients died between 2005 and 2008 than would be expected for the type of hospital,{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/health/healthnews/5008935/NHS-targets-may-have-led-to-1200-deaths-in-Mid-Staffordshire.html |title=NHS targets 'may have led to 1,200 deaths' in Mid-Staffordshire |author=Rebecca Smith (Medical Editor) |publisher=The Daily Telegraph |date=18 March 2009 |accessdate=9 November 2010 |location=London}}{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/top-stories/2009/03/18/up-to-1-200-may-have-died-over-shocking-patient-care-at-stafford-hospital-115875-21206422/ |author=Emily Cook |title=Stafford hospital scandal: Up to 1,200 may have died over "shocking" patient care |publisher=Daily Mirror |date=March 18, 2009 |accessdate=May 6, 2009}} based on figures from a mortality model, but the final Healthcare Commission report concluded it would be misleading to link the inadequate care to a specific number or range of numbers of deaths.{{cite web|title=How many people died "unnecessarily" at Mid Staffs|url=https://fullfact.org/factchecks/francis_many_deaths_unnecessarily_at_mid_staffs-28805|website=Full Fact|accessdate=29 May 2015}}{{citation |url=http://www.midstaffspublicinquiry.com/sites/default/files/report/Volume%201.pdf |title=Independent Inquiry into care provided by Mid Staffordshire NHS Foundation Trust January 2005 – March 2009 |chapter=Volume I, Section G: Mortality statistics |page=352 |author=Robert Francis QC |publisher=The Stationery Office |date=24 February 2010 |id=HC375-I |isbn=978-0-10-296439-4 |accessdate=9 November 2010 |quote=it has been concluded that it would be unsafe to infer from the figures that there was any particular number or range of numbers of avoidable or unnecessary deaths at the Trust.}} An independent 2008 study into hospital standardised mortality ratios found that this measure, as developed by the Dr Foster Unit at Imperial College, is prone to methodological bias, and that it was not credible to claim that variation in mortality ratios reflects differences in quality of care.{{cite journal|url=http://www.bmj.com/content/338/bmj.b780|title=Evidence of methodological bias in hospital standardised mortality ratios: retrospective database study of English hospitals|first1=Mohammed A.|last1=Mohammed|first2=Jonathan J.|last2=Deeks|first3=Alan|last3=Girling|first4=Gavin|last4=Rudge|first5=Martin|last5=Carmalt|first6=Andrew J.|last6=Stevens|first7=Richard J.|last7=Lilford|date=18 March 2009|publisher=|journal=BMJ|volume=338|pages=b780|via=www.bmj.com|doi=10.1136/bmj.b780|pmid=19297447|pmc=2659855}} In 2015, [[The Guardian]] amended an article from 2013:
...subsequent investigations into the poor care at Stafford hospital, including the two reports by Sir Robert Francis QC, said that this disputed estimate, which appeared only in a draft report from 2009 by the Healthcare commission and was based on mortality statistics, was an unreliable measure of avoidable deaths. The Francis report of February 2013 concluded that it would be unsafe to infer from these statistics that there was any particular number of avoidable or unnecessary deaths at the trust.{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/society/2013/feb/06/mid-staffs-hospital-scandal-guide|title=Mid Staffs hospital scandal: the essential guide|last=Campbell|first=Denis|date=2013-02-06|newspaper=The Guardian|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077|access-date=2016-09-09}}
As a result, the trust's chief executive, Martin Yeates, was suspended (with full pay), while its chairman, Toni Brisby, resigned. Both Prime Minister [[Gordon Brown]] and Health Secretary [[Alan Johnson]] apologised to those who suffered at the hospital.{{cite web |url=http://www.thisisstaffordshire.co.uk/news/Breaking-News-Gordon-Brown-says-sorry-Stafford-Hospital-scandalarticle-779452-details/article.html |title=Gordon Brown says sorry for Stafford Hospital scandal |author=R Bramwell |publisher=The Sentinel |date=March 18, 2009 |accessdate=May 6, 2009}} Also in response to the scandal, the mortality rates of all [[National Health Service (England)|National Health Service]] hospitals have been made accessible on a website.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/health/healthnews/5264078/Death-rates-victory-after-Stafford-scandal.html |title=Death rates victory after Stafford scandal |author=Laura Donnelly |publisher=The Daily Telegraph |date=2 May 2009 |accessdate=6 May 2009 |location=London}} It later emerged that a "compromise agreement" had been agreed with Martin Yeates whereby he left the NHS with a large sum of money.{{cite news|title=Former Mid Staffs chief executive was allegedly 'gagged' at taxpayers' expense|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/health/9955868/Former-Mid-Staffs-chief-executive-was-allegedly-gagged-at-taxpayers-expense.html|accessdate=22 November 2013|newspaper=Daily Telegraph|date=26 March 2013|location=London|first=Peter|last=Dominiczak}} He did not give evidence at any of the enquiries, apparently because of health problems, but he was appointed to be Chief Executive of Impact Alcohol and Addiction Services in 2012.{{cite news|title=New top job for Martin Yeates after Stafford Hospital scandal|url=https://www.expressandstar.com/news/2012/11/19/new-top-job-for-martin-yeates-after-stafford-hospital-scandal/|accessdate=22 November 2013|newspaper=Express and Star|date=19 November 2012}} Some executives who had been responsible for the trust at the time received promotions within the health service and were loudly criticised. [[Cynthia Bower]], who was from 2006 chief executive of [[NHS West Midlands]], was recruited to run the [[Care Quality Commission]] [[quango]].{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/health/healthnews/5007652/Stafford-Hospital-execs-land-higly-paid-jobs.html | location=London | work=The Daily Telegraph | first=Rebecca | last=Smith | title=Stafford Hospital execs land {{sic|nolink=y|higly-paid|expected=highly-paid}} jobs | date=18 March 2009}} Sir [[David Nicholson (civil servant)|David Nicholson]] was in charge of the regional health authority responsible for the hospital at the height of the failings between 2005 and 2006.{{cite news|title=Sir David Nicholson quits: NHS chief steps down in wake of Mid Staffs scandal|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/sir-david-nicholson-quits-nhs-chief-steps-down-in-wake-of-mid-staffs-scandal-8625889.html|accessdate=22 November 2013|newspaper=Independent|date=21 May 2013|location=London|first=Oliver|last=Wright}} On 21 July 2009, the [[Secretary of State for Health]], [[Andy Burnham]], announced a further independent inquiry into care provided by Mid Staffordshire Foundation Trust.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/england/staffordshire/8160385.stm |title=Fresh inquiry at failing hospital |publisher=BBC |date=21 July 2009 |accessdate=25 August 2015}} The generally critical inquiry report was published on 24 February 2010. The report made 18 local and national recommendations, including that the regulator, [[Monitor (NHS)|Monitor]], de-authorise the [[NHS Foundation Trust|Foundation Trust]].{{cite book|url=http://www.dh.gov.uk/en/Publicationsandstatistics/Publications/PublicationsPolicyAndGuidance/DH_113018|title=Robert Francis Inquiry report into Mid-Staffordshire NHS Foundation Trust|author=Robert Francis QC|publisher=House of Commons|date=24 February 2010|isbn=978-0-10-296439-4|accessdate=24 February 2010}}{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/society/2010/feb/24/mid-staffordshire-hospital-inquiry |title=Mid Staffordshire NHS trust left patients humiliated and in pain |author=Sarah Boseley |newspaper=The Guardian |date=24 February 2010 |accessdate=25 August 2015}} Compensation payments averaging £11,000 were paid to some of the families involved.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/society/2010/oct/31/mid-staffordshire-nhs-trust-compensation |title=NHS trust pays compensation to victims of 'appalling' patient care |work=Press Association |publisher=The Guardian |date=31 October 2010 |accessdate=31 October 2010 |location=London}} In February 2010, Burnham agreed to a further independent inquiry of the commissioning, supervisory and regulatory bodies for Foundation Trusts. == Public inquiry == In June 2010, the new government announced that a full [[public inquiry]] would be held.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/health/healthnews/5264078/Death-rates-victory-after-Stafford-scandal.html |title=Public inquiry into scandal-hit Stafford Hospital |author=Nick Triggle |publisher=Daily Telegraph |date=9 June 2010 |accessdate=9 June 2010 |location=London}} The inquiry began on 8 November 2010 chaired by [[Robert Francis (barrister)|Robert Francis QC]], who had chaired the fourth inquiry which he had criticised for its narrow remit. The inquiry considered more than a million pages of previous evidence as well as hearing from witnesses.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-11696735 |title=Stafford Hospital public inquiry opens |publisher=BBC |date=8 November 2010 |accessdate=8 November 2010}} UK expert medical lawyers also offered their assistance to distraught and angry families who waited for proof that lessons had been learned. Many families of the victims felt that crucial questions have been left unanswered.{{cite news|url=http://www.irwinmitchell.com/newsandmedia/2013/january/familys-anger-as-they-are-left-waiting-for-proof-that-lessons-are-learnt|last=Dixon|first=Rob|date=13 January 2013|publisher=Irwin Mitchell|accessdate=10 July 2013|location=Sheffield|title=Family’s Anger At Being Left Waiting For Proof That Lessons Are Learnt}} The final report was published on 6 February 2013, making 290 recommendations.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-21341766 |title=Stafford Hospital: Hiding mistakes 'should be criminal offence' |author=Nick Triggle |publisher=BBC |date=6 February 2013 |accessdate=9 February 2013}}{{cite report |url=http://www.midstaffspublicinquiry.com/report |title=Report of the Mid Staffordshire NHS Foundation Trust Public Inquiry. |author=Robert Francis QC |publisher=House of Commons |isbn=978-0-10-298147-6 |date=6 February 2013 |accessdate=9 February 2013}} Academics at the [[University of Oxford]] and [[King's College London]] have criticised its recommendations to legally enforce a new duty of openness, transparency and candour amongst NHS staff, arguing that increasing 'micro-regulation' may produce serious unintended consequences.{{cite web|last=Press Release|title=Study on clinical risk controls in the NHS|url=http://www.sbs.ox.ac.uk/newsandevents/releases/Pages/ClinicalRiskControls.aspx|work=Said Business School, University of Oxford|accessdate=22 February 2013}} The revelations of the neglect to patients at Stafford hospital were widely considered to be deeply shocking by all sections of the mainstream UK press; for example, patients were left in their own urine by nurses.{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/health/healthnews/8801249/Boss-of-scandal-hit-hospital-escapes-cross-examination.html | location=London | work=The Daily Telegraph | first1=Patrick | last1=Sawer | first2=Laura | last2=Donnelly | title=Boss of scandal-hit hospital escapes cross-examination | date=2 October 2011}} == Actions against nurses == The [[Nursing and Midwifery Council]] (NMC), the UK’s regulator of nurses and midwives, has held hearings about nurses working in the trust following allegations that they were not fit to practise. Acting to protect the public, the NMC has struck off from their register and suspended 2 nurses as a result of these hearings. This includes two nurses who falsified accident and emergency discharge times,{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-stoke-staffordshire-23450764 | work=BBC News | title=Stafford nurses struck off over waiting times | date=25 July 2013}} two nurses involved in the death of a diabetic patient{{cite news| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-stoke-staffordshire-24174040 | work=BBC News | title=Nurse struck off for Stafford Hospital death | date=20 September 2013}} and a nurse who physically and verbally abused a dementia patient.{{cite news| url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/health/healthnews/9870691/Mid-Staffs-midwife-struck-off-but-still-employed-as-a-carer.html | location=London | work=The Daily Telegraph | first=Hayley | last=Dixon | title=Mid Staffs midwife struck off, but still employed as a carer | date=14 February 2013}} == See also == * [[Institutional abuse]] * [[Patient abuse]] * [[Winterbourne View hospital abuse]] == [http://www.fortv.se Fortv.se] |footnotes = }} The '''Swedish Fortifications Agency (SFA)''' ({{lang-sv|Fortifikationsverket}}, abbreviated {{lang|sv|FortV}}) is a [[Government agencies in Sweden|Swedish government agency]] under the [[Ministry of Finance (Sweden)|Swedish Ministry of Finance]] ({{lang|sv|Finansdepartementet}}), tasked with managing [[government-owned]] defense-related buildings and land.[[#MOF_ordinance|Ministry of Finance 2007]] The agency functions as the [[landlord]] for the [[Swedish Armed Forces]] ({{lang|sv|Försvarsmakten}}), managing various types of [[military installation]]s.[[#Holmstrom|Holmström 2008]] The SFA is one of the largest holders of [[real estate]] in Sweden. ==Function in the government== The formation of the SFA in 1994 was part of the Swedish government effort to increase the cost-efficiency of government real estate usage through a system of [[internal rent]], which was meant to emulate [[market-like]] conditions.[[#Statskontoret_2004|Swedish Agency for Public Management 2004]], p. 5-6 The main purpose with the reform was to create economic incentives for the authorities in the public sector to economise on premises.[[#Lind_2005|Lind 2005]] In the defense sector, the real estate holdings were transferred from the [[Swedish Armed Forces]] — the user of the real estate — to the SFA; with the Swedish Armed Forces remaining in the estate as a tenant. Currently, the SFA acts as [[landlord]] for several Swedish government agencies in the defense sector.[[#SFA_yf2007|Swedish Fortifications Agency 2007]], p. 12. The main tenant is the Swedish Armed Forces, which in 2007 was the source of over 90% of the SFA:s [[revenue]]. ==Economy== The SFA does not receive an allowance from the [[government budget]].[[#MOF_regulation|Ministry of Finance 2009]], p. 5. Instead, it covers its expenses by charging [[renting|rent]] for the real estate it leases. In 2008, the agency's [[revenue]] was 3.0 billion [[Swedish Krona|SEK]], and its [[net income]] 67 million SEK. The rent is adjusted so that the net income — which goes into the state [[treasury]] — conforms to a predefined level of [[return on equity]], as set by the [[Ministry of Finance (Sweden)|Ministry of Finance]].[[#MOF_regulation|Ministry of Finance 2009]], p. 1. To finance [[investment]]s, the SFA borrows money from the [[National Debt Office (Sweden)|National Debt Office]] ({{lang|sv|Riksgälden}}), which acts as the internal bank of the government.[[#MOF_2003|Ministry of Finance 2003]] ==Personnel== The SFA employed 689 people in 2008. The majority of the employees work on a local level in real estate units linked to [[garrison]]s,[[#SFA_ar2008|Swedish Fortifications Agency 2008]], p. 7. where employees work in areas such as [[project management]], [[property development]] and [[Maintenance, repair and operations|maintenance services]].[[#SFA_web|Swedish Fortifications Agency]]: {{cite web |url=http://www.fortv.se/templates/PageWide.aspx?id=62 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-07-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090828060713/http://www.fortv.se/templates/PageWide.aspx?id=62 |archivedate=2009-08-28 |df= }} At the regional and national level, employees work in real estate purchasing and sales, defense facility development, and various management functions. The SFA considers its [[core competencies]] to be security and protective technology.[[#SFA_ar2008|Swedish Fortifications Agency 2008]], p. 5. The agency has stated that it aims to increase the amount of [[outsourcing]], and as an experiment in 2006, it outsourced the property maintenance of two [[garrison]]s.[[#SFA_afr2007|Swedish Fortifications Agency 2007]], p. 8. [[File:Karlbergs slott från Stadshagen.jpg|thumb|350px|right|[[Karlberg Palace]] in [[Solna Municipality|Solna]], [[Stockholm]] — which houses the [[Military Academy Karlberg]] — is one of the properties managed by the SFA.[[#SFA_web|Swedish Fortifications Agency]]: {{cite web |url=http://www.fortv.se/templates/Page.aspx?id=215 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-07-19 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080422025757/http://www.fortv.se/templates/Page.aspx?id=215 |archivedate=2008-04-22 |df= }}]] ==Real estate stock== In 2008, the [[book value]] of the government real estate stock managed by the SFA was 10.1 billion [[Swedish krona|SEK]],[[#SFA_ar2008|Swedish Fortifications Agency]], p. 39. largely consisting of depots, [[garrison]]s, training facilities, offices, and [[proving ground]]s.[[#SFA_yf2007|Swedish Fortifications Agency 2007]], pp. 18, 20. In 2007, the total real estate stock included:[[#SFA_web|Swedish Fortifications Agency]] {{cite web |url=http://www.fortv.se/templates/Page.aspx?id=470 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2009-07-11 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070708235603/http://www.fortv.se/templates/Page.aspx?id=470 |archivedate=2007-07-08 |df= }} * 8 000 buildings * 3.3 million square meters of open Technology for Peace is a Cyprus-based peoples' initiative launched in 1995 to serve the needs of peace pioneers on the divided island.
==History== The peace portal <ref>{{cite web |url=http://mirror.undp.org/cyprus/projects/project_details.asp?ProjectID=105 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2010-08-02 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110724203325/http://mirror.undp.org/cyprus/projects/project_details.asp?ProjectID=105 |archivedate=2011-07-24 |df= }}</ref> was born because it was deemed needed. What led to its birth was neither the availability of relevant technology nor the availability of funding, because both were not there. The ban of bi-communal meetings imposed by the Turkish Cypriot Authorities following the EU’s decision to postpone accession negotiations with Turkey (summit meeting in Luxembourg, December 1997) stopped face-to-face dialogues (during the time window 1994-1997) and threatened to nullify all peace building efforts on the island. The idea came out of several (# 9, 10 & 11) of the 15 peace promoting projects, which made it to the final [[Cyprus_Conflict_Resolution_Trainers_Group#Cyprus_Peace_Bazaar|Cyprus Peace Bazaar]] organized by the [[Cyprus Conflict Resolution Trainers Group]] in 1995.
==Tech4Peace vision== The vision, which underpinned the project Technology For Peace (Tech4Peace) was to enhance in Cyprus one of the most basic human rights, the right of communication, by applying modern technology in the service of peace with emphasis on the usage of Internet and Internet-based applications. A promising and creative way to enhance inter-communal communication where there exist substantial hindrances to direct contact between peoples is through the use of the Internet. Cyberspace and Internet provide an efficient, fast, tractable, confidential, organized, time and space independent means of communication. As individuals and organizations throughout the world continue to demonstrate, the Internet can overcome the challenge posed by physical separation, whether due to geographic, political or other reasons, by effectively moving discourse into "cyberspace."
==Activities== The Tech4Peace team organized a series of trainings in the usage of the net to communicate across the dividing line in the years 1996-1998. In 1998, with USAID funding given to Dr. [[Hrach Gregorian]], cyber peace cafes on the northern and southern parts of Nicosia have been set up within CYBER KIDS centers, from where peace builders could communicate with their peers on the other side. Participants were also exposed to the ICONS project<ref>https://www.icons.umd.edu ICONS Project</ref>, developed at the [[University of Maryland, College Park|University of Maryland]], using simulations and scenario-driven exercises to advance their understanding of complex problems and strengthen their ability to make decisions, navigate crises, think strategically, and negotiate collaboratively. In the next years, the project team developed theory of how technology in general can serve bridge the divides,<ref>Laouris, Y. and Laouri, R. (2008). Can Information and mobile technologies serve close the economic, educational, digital and social gaps and accelerate development? World Futures, 64(4), 254-275.</ref> as well as how technology can support the ethical engagement of all stakeholders in a dialogue which concerns their own futures<ref>Laouris, Y., Laouri, R. and Christakis, A. (2008). Communication praxis for ethical accountability; The ethics of the tree of action. Syst Res Behav Sci 25(2), 331–348.</ref> .
==Contributions== The Tech4Peace project has been evaluated by Nathan Associates <ref>Nathan Associates, FINAL REPORT, CYPRUS BI-COMMUNAL DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM EVALUATION. Prepared for the United States Agency for International Development. IQC No. AEP-I-00-00-00023-00. Evaluation team: Richard Blue (Team Leader), Vivikka Molldrem, Craig Webster, Alejandro Gonzales, Mine Yucel, Yiorghos Leventis</ref> for the [[United States Agency for International Development]] as a project that has contributed towards Peace and Reconciliation in Cyprus. It was one of few projects, which received support multiple times and were funded by the [[UNOPS]], [[United Nations]] funding scheme during the very first funding cycle.
==Founding members== The Tech4Peace project was founded as one of the selected [[Cyprus_Conflict_Resolution_Trainers_Group#Cyprus_Peace_Bazaar|Cyprus Peace Bazaar]] Projects in 1997. The members of the founding team were [[Yiannis Laouris]], [[Harry Anastasiou]], Dervis Besimler and Bekir Azgin. They were all members of the [[Cyprus Conflict Resolution Trainers Group]].
==Publications== Laouris, Y. and Tziapouras, G. (2002). Technology used for peace in Cyprus. Peacebuilding 3(3), 4-8.
Laouris, Y. (2004). Information technology in the service of peace building. The case of Cyprus. World Futures, 60, 67–79.

{{notability|bio|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox writer <!-- for more information see [[:Template:Infobox writer/doc]] --> | name = Tom Cotter | image = Tom Cotter.jpg | imagesize = | caption = | pseudonym = | birth_name = | birth_date = 1972 | birth_place = [[Robins AFB]], [[Warner Robins, Georgia]] [[United States]] | occupation = | nationality = | ethnicity = | citizenship = US Citizen | education = | alma_mater = | period = | genre = | subject = | movement = | notableworks = | spouse = Christi Gaither | partner = | children = 3 | relatives = | influences = | influenced = | awards = | signature = | website = | portaldisp = }}
'''Tom Cotter '''(born 1972) is an American [[Conservation movement|conservationist]], entrepreneur, [[renewable energy]] advocate, and ordained [[evangelical]] minister living in [[Clovis, California|Clovis]], [[California]].
==Biography==
===Early life and inspiration=== Tom Cotter grew up in [[Napa County, California|Napa Valley]], [[California]], [[United States]]. A significant influence was the [[Boy Scouts of America]]. In 1988, Cotter was awarded the title of Eagle Scout. <ref>{{cite web |title=List of Eagle Scouts |url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Eagle_Scouts |publisher=Wikipedia |accessdate=21 August 2018}}</ref>
===Professional career=== In 1997, he was [[ordained]] [[clergy]] at First [[Christian Church]] in [[Napa, California]]. He served as a pastor at [[Non denominational|Clovis Christian Church]] in Clovis, California from 1996 to 2006.
From 2006 to 2015 he worked in sales leadership in the [[Photovoltaics in the United States|U.S. Photovoltaic Industry]], starting at ReGrid Power, which was later acquired by [[Real Goods Solar]]. He also worked at [[Sunrun]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Extreme Weather and Climate Change |url=https://valleycafesci.wordpress.com/2015/01/15/extreme-weather-and-climate-change/ |website=Central Valley Cafe Scientifique |publisher=aranyak}}</ref>
From 2015 to 2017 he worked as Regional Sales Manager at [https://renewfinancial.com/ Renew Financial] for the [[California]] counties of [[Fresno County, California|Fresno]], [[Madera County, California|Madera]], [[Tulare County, California|Tulare]], and [[Kings County, California|Kings]].
Cotter has taught as adjunct professor<ref>{{cite web |url=http://fresnoalliance.com/wordpress/?p=934 |title=What's the Big Deal with Earth Day? |accessdate=2010-08-12 |work=Jessica Mast |publisher=Community Alliance}}</ref> of [[Ecotheology|Theological Ethics and the Environment]] at [[Fresno Pacific University]].
===Personal life=== Cotter resides in [[Clovis, California]] with his wife, Christi Gaither, and their three children. The family has a solar power and solar thermal system on their home. Mr. Cotter drives a 100% electric [[Nissan Leaf]]. Mrs. Cotter drives an alternative fuel VW Jetta [[TDi|TDI]]. The Cotter family uses [[Vermipost#Vermicompost|vermiposting]] to turn kitchen scraps, junk mail and paper packing materials into nutrient rich soil for their garden and yard.<ref>{{cite web |title=Your Green Life |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tKnLqVL53Mo |publisher=NBC KSEE24 |accessdate=21 August 2018}}</ref>
Cotter is a part of the California Climate Ride, a 320-mile bicycle benefit ride for bicycle advocacy and renewable energy down the coast of California from Eureka, California to San Francisco, California.
===Sustainability education and advocacy===
[[File:TomCotter-FresnoSolar.jpg|thumb|right|alt=Tom Cotter on PBS TV being interviewed about the future of solar. |Tom Cotter on PBS TV being interviewed about the future of [[photovoltaics|solar]].]]
====Community====
In 2007, Cotter and Socient CEO, Victor Ramayrat, co-founded Green Fresno,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.greenfresno.org/page/about-us |title=Green Fresno |accessdate=2010-08-12 |work= |publisher=Victor Ramayrat}}</ref> a free [[Social network|online community]] and [[Web portal|information portal]] (in 2012 it was relaunched as Green Central Valley).
Cotter is the organizer and curator of the annual Fresno Solar Tour<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fresnosolartour.com |title=Fresno Solar Tour |accessdate=2010-08-12 |work= |publisher=Tom Cotter}}</ref> part of the [[American Solar Energy Society]]'s [[National Solar Tour]].
Cotter is an Organizer of Fresno [[Earth Day]], purposed to inspire and mobilize individuals and organizations to demonstrate their commitment to environmental protection and sustainability.
Cotter is founder and coordinator of Fresno Green Drinks, an informal monthly gathering of environmental field professionals, educators, public servants, activists, and people wanting to learn and inspire each other towards broader ecological stewardship in the [[Fresno]] metro area. As of May, 2012, [[Green Drinks]] was active in 642 cities worldwide.
In 2012, Cotter became a Climate Leader in the Climate Leadership Corps with the [[Climate Reality Project]].
Cotter served as a Technical Advisory Committee Member for [https://www.lgc.org/energize-fresno/ Energize Fresno] in the Private Business, Development, and Finance Sector in 2017.<ref name="Technical Advisory Committee List">{{cite web |title=Energize Fresno Master Community Design |url=https://www.lgc.org/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/2018/02/Energize-Fresno-Master-Community-Design.pdf |website=Local Government Commission |publisher=Local Government Commission}}</ref>
====Board of directors==== Cotter serves on the Board of Directors of the Solar Living Institute.<ref>{{cite web |title=SLI Board |url=https://solarliving.org/about/about-sli/staff-aamp-board |website=Solar Living |publisher=Solar Living Institute}}</ref>
Cotter is the past President and Chairman of the Board of Directors at the International Green Industry Hall of Fame,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.gogreenhall.org/about/board-members/tom-cotter/ |title=International Green Industry Hall of Fame Board Members |accessdate=2012-01-28 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120401200412/http://www.gogreenhall.org/about/board-members/tom-cotter/ |archivedate=2012-04-01 |df= }}</ref> which promotes ecological sustainability worldwide through recognizing individuals and organizations for outstanding achievement(s) in the Green Industry and provides an educational forum for the international public.<ref>{{cite web |title=Urbee Honored with IGIHOF Environmental Award |url=https://korecologic.com/2013/03/13/urbee-honoured-with-environmental-award/ |website=Kor Ecologic |publisher=Jim Kor}}</ref>
Cotter is a past Board of Director member at [[Restore Hetch Hetchy]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Comments of Restore Hetch Hetchy on the State Water Resources Control Board's Lower San Joaquin River Draft Substitute Environmental Document |url=https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/waterrights/water_issues/programs/hearings/fahey/exhibits/fahey78.pdf |website=California Water Boards |publisher=California Water Boards}}</ref>
====Film====
Cotter is a producer of the short [[documentary film]], Forest Man.<ref>{{cite web |title=Forest Man Producer |url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm5880521/ |website=IMDB |publisher=William D McMaster}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Forest Man Film |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HkZDSqyE1do |website=YouTube |publisher=William D McMaster}}</ref> The film chronicles the story of [[Jadav Payeng]], an Indian man who single-handedly planted nearly 1,400 acres of forest to save his island, [[Majuli]], [[India]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Manimugdha|first=Sharma|title=The man who made a forest|url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-04-01/special-report/31269649_1_forest-wild-elephants-red-ants|work=The Times of India|accessdate=13 June 2013}}</ref> The film is directed by William D. McMaster of Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The film was released in the summer, 2013.
====Political==== In 2010, Cotter worked with California's No on [[Prop 23]] Campaign.<ref>{{cite web |title=Californians to Stop the Dirty Energy Proposition |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/35906407/No-on-Prop-23-General-Factsheet |website=Scribd |publisher=Prop 23 Central Valley Campaign}}</ref> This proposition would have suspended [[AB 32]], a law enacted in 2006 legally referred to as the Global Warming Solutions Act of 2006. Prop 23 was defeated by California voters during the statewide election by a 23% margin.<ref>[http://vote.sos.ca.gov/returns/ballot-measures/ Summary of Ballot Measure Voting, California Secretary of State] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101105205625/http://vote.sos.ca.gov/returns/ballot-measures/ |date=2010-11-05 }}</ref><ref>[http://www.sos.ca.gov/contest_summary.pdf County Summary Status for the November 2, 2010, Statewide General Election] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101103071138/http://www.sos.ca.gov/contest_summary.pdf |date=November 3, 2010 }}, California secretary of state, 3 November 2010</ref>
In 2012, Cotter worked to get the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) to expand [[net metering]] in California. {{citation needed|date=July 2013}}
In 2012, Cotter worked towards the passing of [[Proposition 39 (2012)|Proposition 39 - California Clean Energy Jobs Act]].{{citation needed|date=July 2013}}

{{Infobox political party |name = United Party of Retirees and Pensioners |native_name = Partido Unido dos Reformados e Pensionistas |colorcode = green |leader = [[António Mateus Dias]] & [[Fernando Loureiro]] |logo = PURP party logo.png |foundation = {{Start date|2015|07|13}} |ideology = [[List of pensioners' parties|Pensioners' rights]]
[[Anti-austerity movement|Anti-austerity]] |position = [[Big tent]] |headquarters = Rua Tenente Ferreira Durão, 56 – r/c Dtº 1350-317 Lisbon |country = Portugal |website =http://www.purp.pt/ |seats1_title = [[Assembly of the Republic (Portugal)|Assembly of the Republic]] |seats1 = {{Composition bar|0|230|green}} }} The '''United Party of Retirees and Pensioners''' ({{lang-pt|Partido Unido dos Reformados e Pensionistas}}, '''PURP''') is a [[Portugal|Portuguese]] political party focused on securing the rights of pensioners.http://www.publico.pt/politica/noticia/partido-unido-dos-reformados-e-pensionistas-quer-concorrer-as-proximas-eleicoes-1691650 It was founded by [[António Mateus Dias]] and [[Fernando Loureiro]] and registered by the Portuguese [[Constitutional Court of Portugal|Constitutional Court]] on 13 July 2015.http://www.tribunalconstitucional.pt/tc/acordaos/20150370.html It contested the [[Portuguese legislative election, 2015|2015 Portuguese legislative elections]]. The party is generally [[anti-austerity]] and sees itself as a defender of the weak and vulnerable in Portuguese society, which also includes people in poor, neglected inland areas. They claim to be "defending the values of human dignity, freedom, justice and [[solidarity]]".http://www.purp.pt/declaracao-de-principios/ Their main goal is to raise minimum pensions to the national [[minimum wage]]. Other goals are promoting [[Transparency (behavior)|transparency]] in the [[public sector]], preventing corruption and [[cronyism]], securing free health and education for ordinary people, [[non-discrimination]] on the grounds of age, race, religion and gender and separating political power from economic power.http://www.purp.pt/declaracao-de-principios/ == Environmentalism == PURP has a [[Green (politics)|Green]] agenda and wants to secure [[environmental protection]] and promote [[sustainable development]], as a precautionary principle for future generations.http://www.purp.pt/declaracao-de-principios/ == Foreign policy == In [[foreign policy]], the party defends that Portugal should advocate regulation of the economic and financial system at the global level as well as the abolition of [[tax havens]] and support the [[UN]] in obtaining these goals.http://www.purp.pt/declaracao-de-principios/ == References == {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{official|http://www.purp.pt}} {{pt icon}} {{Portuguese political parties}} [[Category:2015 establishments in Portugal]] [[Category:Pensioners' parties]] [[Category:Political parties established in 2015]] [[Category:Political parties in Portugal]]

{{Infobox Political post |post = Vice President |body = the Republic of Abkhazia |insignia = Coat of arms of Abkhazia.svg |insigniasize = 125px |insigniacaption = [[Coat of arms of Abkhazia]] |image = |incumbent = [[Vitali Gabnia]] |incumbentsince = 25 September 2014 |residence = [[Sukhumi]] |appointer = |termlength = 5 years |inaugural = [[Valery Arshba]] |formation = 26 November 1994 |website = }} {{Politics of Abkhazia}} The '''Vice President of the Abkhaz Republic''', an [[partially recognized state]], internationally regarded as a part of [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]], is the first in the presidential line of succession, becoming the new [[President of Abkhazia]] upon the death, resignation, or removal of the President. Additionally, the Vice President would assume the presidency in case the President becomes incapable of carrying out the presidential duties. ==Eligibility== According to the article 54 of the [[Wikisource:Constitution of Abkhazia|Constitution of Abkhazia]], a citizen of Abkhazia, no younger than 35 years old and no older than 65 years old, who is in possession of suffrage, may be elected Vice President. The Vice President shall not be member of the [[Abkhazian People's Assembly|Parliament]], or hold any other offices in state or public bodies as well as in businesses. ==Election== The Vice President is elected simultaneously with the President. A candidate for Vice President is nominated by a candidate for President. ==Duties== The Vice-President executes individual assignments on a commission of the President and acts for the President in his absence or in case when it is impossible for the President to attend to his duties. ==List of Vice Presidents of Abkhazia== On 25 December 2013, Mikhail Logua announced his resignation as Vice President for health reasons.{{cite news|title=Вице-президент Михаил Логуа намерен оставить свой пост|url=http://apsnypress.info/news/10925.html|accessdate=8 June 2014|agency=Apsnypress|date=25 December 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131226160643/http://apsnypress.info/news/10925.html|archive-date=26 December 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |- align=center bgcolor=#ebebeb !rowspan=2|№ !rowspan=2|Name

{{notability|Companies|date=October 2015}} The '''Western Political Science Association''' (WPSA) is a [[professional association]] of [[political science]] scholars and students in the [[United States]] that was founded in 1947.
== Aims == The purpose of the WPSA is to promote the study and teaching of government and politics, to foster political research, and to facilitate a greater dialogue involving public affairs and policy making. The official region of the WPSA includes the western states of [[Alaska]], [[Arizona]], [[California]], [[Colorado]], [[Hawaii]], [[Idaho]], [[Montana]], [[Nevada]], [[New Mexico]], [[Oregon]], [[Texas]], [[Utah]], and [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]]. In addition, it includes the Canadian provinces of [[Alberta]], [[British Columbia]], and [[Saskatchewan]]. However, one-third of the association’s members are from other states and nations.<ref name="csus">{{cite web |url=http://www.csus.edu/org/wpsa/ |title=WPSA Home Page |accessdate=2011-04-15}}</ref>
== History == The WPSA was founded in November, 1947, and held its first meeting at the [[University of Utah]].<ref>{{cite journal |doi=10.1177/106591295600900202 |title=The Western Political Science Association: The First Ten Years and the Next Ten |year=1956 |last1=Durham |first1=G. H. |journal=Political Research Quarterly |volume=9 |issue=2 |pages=250}}</ref> At this time a constitution was adopted and officers were elected for the new organization. The first president of the association was [[G. Homer Durham]] ([[University of Utah]]). The WPSA was the second regional political science association formally recognized by the [[American Political Science Association]]. In 1995, the WPSA became incorporated in [[California]] as a nonprofit public benefit corporation. In 1998, the WPSA Executive Council appointed Elizabeth Moulds from [[California State University Sacramento]] to serve as the association's first Executive Director. Including her term as Executive Director, Moulds served as the chief administrative officer for the association for 25 years, before stepping down in 2009.
== Annual meeting == The WPSA Annual Meeting is a gathering of political scientists that rotates throughout the region. It occurs over a weekend in March or April each spring. Approximately 1,100 to 1,300 political scientists participate in this conference annually. The conference provides a forum for scholars to share research, discuss political science education, and network with other experts in their field.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.csus.edu/org/wpsa/mtgs.stm |title=WPSA: Annual Meeting |accessdate=2011-04-17}}</ref>
== Officers == The current offices of the association are: * President: Manuel Avalos ([[University of North Carolina]]) * Vice-President/Program Chair: Peregrine Schwartz-Shea (University of Utah) * Recording Secretary: Noelle Norton ([[University of San Diego]]) * Treasurer: Michael W. Bowers ([[University of Nevada, Reno|University of Nevada]]) * Executive Director: Richard Clucas ([[Portland State University]]) * Associate Director: Elsa J. Favila
== Awards == To recognize excellence in the profession, the association offers annual awards that are presented at the regional conference:<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.csus.edu/org/wpsa/awards.stm/ |title=WPSA: Annual Awards |accessdate=2011-04-17}}</ref> * Dissertation Award: Presented to an individual paper with the best doctoral dissertation completed at a university. * [[Pi Sigma Alpha]] Award: Presented to the best paper presented at the previous WPSA annual meeting. * The Betty Nesvold Women and Politics Award: Presented for the best paper on women and politics presented at the previous annual meeting. * WPSA Best Paper Award on Latina/Latino Politics: Awarded for an outstanding paper on Latina/Latino politics and its relative aspects. * Award by Committee on the Status of Blacks: Awarded for an outstanding paper discussing issues and problems which concern most Black Americans. * Charles Redd Award for Best Paper on the Politics of the American West: an award offered jointly by the WPSA and the Charles Redd Center for Western Studies of [[Brigham Young University]] for the best paper on the politics of the American West. * The Political Research Quarterly Best Article Award: This award is given for the best article published by the PRQ during the prior calendar year. * WPSA Best Paper in Environmental Political Theory Award: Awarded to the best paper in environmental political theory presented at the annual WPSA meeting.
== Publications == The association publishes two [[academic journal]]s.<ref name="csus" /> * The ''Western Political Quarterly'' has served as the official journal of the organization since it was first published by the University of Utah in March, 1948. The relationship between the association and the journal was formalized in 1971. The journal was renamed ''[[Political Research Quarterly]]'' in 1992.<ref>{{cite journal |doi=10.1177/1065912909346698 |title=Where We Came from: Defining the Western Political Science Association: A Brief, Very Selective Organizational History Sampled from the Archives of the WPSA|jstor=25594452|year=2009 |last1=Moulds |first1=E. |journal=Political Research Quarterly |volume=62 |issue=4 |pages=840}}</ref> * ''Politics, Groups, and Identities'', a new journal that was launched in 2013 covering questions and issues of [[identity politics]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tandfonline.com/loi/rpgi20 |title=Politics, Groups, and Identities |accessdate=2016-10-19}}</ref>
== References == {{Reflist|30em}}
== External links == *{{Official website|http://wpsa.research.pdx.edu/}}

{{ Infobox Livery Company | name = Worshipful Company of Cordwainers | image = [[File:Cordwainers-crest.jpg]] | motto = ''Corio et Arte'' | location = c/o Clothworkers' Hall, Dunster Court,
Mincing Lane,
London EC3R 7AH | formation = 1272 | association = Leather industries | precedence = 27th | master = Patrick Peal | website = [http://www.cordwainers.org/ www.cordwainers.org] }} The '''Worshipful Company of Cordwainers''' is one of the [[Livery Company|Livery Companies]] of the [[City of London]]. [[Cordwainer]]s were workers in fine leather; the Company gets its name from "cordwain" ([[Leather#Cordwain.2C .22Cordovan.22 or .22Spanish leather.22|cordovan]]), the white leather produced from [[goatskin (material)|goatskin]] in [[Córdoba, Andalusia|Cordova]], [[Spain]]. All fine leather makers, including [[Worshipful Company of Girdlers|Girdlers]] and [[Worshipful Company of Glovers|Glovers]], were originally classified as cordwainers; however, the term eventually came to refer only to fine leather [[footwear]], including [[boot]]s. The Cordwainers' Company, which received the right to regulate City trade in 1272 (the same year as the [[Worshipful Company of Curriers|Curriers]]), obtained a [[Royal Charter]] of incorporation in 1439. The status of the Company as a trade association has lessened over the years;[http://www.london-footprints.co.uk/artliverycos.htm City Livery Companies] the Company is now, as are most other Livery Companies, a charitable body. Other leather-linked Livery Companies, which enjoy close relations with the Cordwainers include not only the [[Worshipful Company of Curriers|Curriers]], but the [[Worshipful Company of Leathersellers|Leathersellers]], [[Worshipful Company of Saddlers|Saddlers]] and [[Worshipful Company of Tallow Chandlers|Tallow Chandlers]] Companies too. The Company ranks twenty-seventh in the [[order of precedence]] of Livery Companies and is the highest ranked one without its own Livery Hall. The Company's [[motto]] is ''Corio et Arte'', [[Latin]] for ''Leather and Art''. The [[livery hall]] of the Cordwainers, [[Cordwainers' Hall]], stood near St. Paul's Churchyard from 1316 until its destruction in the [[London blitz]] in 1941.{{cite book|author=John Kennedy Melling|title=London's Guilds and Liveries|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=S6eBkp6zZ9UC&pg=PA54|year=2003|publisher=Osprey Publishing|isbn=978-0-7478-0559-5|pages=53–}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.cordwainers.org/ The Cordwainers' Company] {{Livery Companies in the City of London}} {{coords|51.51144|-0.08109|display=title}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Cordwainers, Worshipful Company of}} [[Category:Livery companies]] [[Category:1272 establishments in England]] [[Category:Corporatism]] [[Category:Companies of medieval England]] [[Category:Charities based in London]] {{London-stub}}
